moves.1. d4: This game involves me playing a horrible opening and a terrific endgame.  I have a habit of bizzare opening . But I like to experiment with new stuff. It sometimes throws off better players. Even playing white I am the underdog.
moves.1... d5 2. g3: Went with a hyper modern opening- controling the center with less pawns.
moves.3... Ne4 4. Bd2 Nc6 5. e3: Now you see why... moving the same piece twice.... trapped on one side by pawns....
moves.5... Bf5 6. Bg2 e6 7. Nc3 Bd6: Good development by black, about to fix my bad opening.
moves.8. Nxe4 dxe4 9. f3 exf3 10. Bxf3: Now I got some room to work with.  Need to finish the development.
moves.10... Qe7: 10......Qe7?    Causes a double pawn. No good for black.
moves.11. Bxc6+ bxc6 12. c4: Now the more traditional c4 to match the d4 pawn move... just the 12th move instead of the 2nd.
moves.12... Be4 13. Nf3 Bb4 14. O-O: 14.O-O! Brilliant. Got out of two pins in 1 move. Now to go on the offensive at last.
Notice that black controls two half rows- but is countered by my  superior pawn structure. Do you see the three way fork?
moves.18... h6 19. Ne5: 19.Ne5!  The c6 square is ohhh so dangerous for black. I will use that pressure to trap black's bishop - then do my dirty work.
moves.19... Rdf8 20. Rf4 Bd5 21. e4: In this position he is forced to sacrifice to save the queen/rook.
moves.23... g5 24. h4 f6 25. hxg5: 25. hxg5!! My best play of the game. Horse sacrifice to lead to mate in 9. I will be truthful and say that I didn't see the exact mate , but I knew opening the f-h files would lead to a mate, just not exactly how yet.
moves.25... fxe5 26. gxh6+ Kh8 27. Rg7: This move sets up bringing in my queen then other rook to take advantage of the open rows and that critical h6 pawn.
moves.29. Qxe5 Qf8 30. Rf1: The last straw . Blacks position is over!!!
moves.32... Rbg8 33. Qh5+ Rh7 34. Qxh7#:
One of my best game endgames against a better player,
Jeremy Ross
